intro: Dactylostigma, commonly known as the "spear-leaved" plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and often serrated leaves that resemble a spear. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Dactylostigma species are typically found in temperate regions and thrive in well-drained soils. These plants are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
